title: Raceonsucced
author: Raceonsucced
content: Corruption often occurs in government, and hinders the growth of the country. There are many corruptors who are caught and end up in prison, but there are also many who are not caught. In my opinion, corrupt people are always covered in anxiety, for fear of being found out by their superiors. But do you think when someone becomes corrupt, will he be happy or miserable in the future?

comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: Corrupt people exist in every sector, not just corrupt governments and rulers.  Corruption, when it is at the head of power, affects all sectors, and they all become corrupt.  But in general, even if the governments are good, corruption cannot be completely eradicated, because it is in human nature that there are opportunistic people.The least corrupt countries are those with legislation capable of holding accountable and tracking the corrupt without these having a legislative cover to protect them.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: While I agree corruption is something which is not to be tolerated in any civilized country, I disagree that every corrupt person in a position of power lives in anxiety.In highly corrupt societies, it has become so normalized that most of those crooks unfortunately feel safe enough, because they and their bosses are equally corrupt and a disgrace for their country.Regardless how they feel internally, all of them should be put in jail, as law usually states.

comments.author: Swordsoffreedom
comments.body: Quote from: Raceonsucced on January 29, 2023, 12:10:21 PMCorruption often occurs in government, and hinders the growth of the country. There are many corruptors who are caught and end up in prison, but there are also many who are not caught. In my opinion, corrupt people are always covered in anxiety, for fear of being found out by their superiors. But do you think when someone becomes corrupt, will he be happy or miserable in the future?What I see in my country is corrupt people never feel regret or pain, instead, they are very happy, living a life many people dream of. There were also corrupt people arrested but they did not regret having brought wealth to their families, they are willing to go to jail as long as their families are well off. Quote from: Hispo on January 30, 2023, 01:02:03 AMRegardless how they feel internally, all of them should be put in jail, as law usually states.  But the most corrupt are the most powerful, so imprisoning them is what we want, but it won't happen. Nowadays, corruption has become a culture, it is rampant, and we hate corrupt people because we are not like them. Honestly, I believe that if we have the opportunity to be corrupt, we are no different from them.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Raceonsucced on January 29, 2023, 12:10:21 PMCorruption often occurs in government, and hinders the growth of the country. There are many corruptors who are caught and end up in prison, but there are also many who are not caught. In my opinion, corrupt people are always covered in anxiety, for fear of being found out by their superiors. But do you think when someone becomes corrupt, will he be happy or miserable in the future?Corruption doesn't only happen in government because it is prevalent in every area of the society. There is even corruption in religious institution that is generally percieved as clean or free from corruption. There is also corruption in the educational sector because students cheat in examination, while teachers collect bribe to give student undeserved grades. There is corruption is sports where match fixing and bribery is popular. We even heard the news of corruption in FIFA.  But corruption in government is the most popular because elections are won via corrupt means and this would lead to the institutionalization of corruption.These days the government protect corrupt officials from prosecution, that is why most of them are not scared or afraid. But the truth is that you cannot cheat nature. Whatever you sow in life you must also reap. Some of these corrupt individuals end up miserable maybe because of sickness or other misfortune. Some of them give birth to wayward children that engage in criminal activities or become addicts to either drugs, women or gambling.

comments.author: tsaroz
comments.body: In my personal experience, corrupt people spend their money recklessly and them and their family would have low value for it. It would make their lifestyle unhealthy. No one stays in power and position for ever and when they come out of one, they would have a messed up family and relations.

comments.author: Spaceman1000$
comments.body: Corruptors are emboldened by their corrupt practices, they don't feel a single atom of regret after leaving office. The proceeds of corruption makes them to leave in affluence, they can easily evade justice ⚖️ by one means or the other. So i believe they don't feel any regrets or miserable at all.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: For certain people in my country, corruption has become just part of daily life. Many people consider it as a means of surviving in the challenging economy. You must develop the ability to give and receive without feeling anxious if you want to be at the top of a particular sector. You can use your money to bribe your way out of corruption, even if you are caught doing it.

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: More people believe that there is always a pay day for the bad you've done in the world before you leave it forever. People get away with it until the end of time, despite their religious beliefs. Corruption is not solely the fault of government leaders or rulers; it is a disease that has already infected the minds of many people today. People are corrupt from a young age because they are exposed to a corrupt environment and cannot escape it even when they reach adulthood, and this pattern continues. I don't believe that corruption can be eliminated entirely, but it can be reduced to a manageable level.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Corruption is something that has eaten up the bones of people in the society because of greedy intentions. People who are corrupt might be safe and live comfortable because they are in high positions or have superiors that backs them up,but I know that deep down in their heart,they feel guilty because sometimes,they are been hunt by their evil deeds.Most of them end up living a miserable life,they there is a change in government,and the new government spotted them out,there will be no option but to put them in jail. The bible tells us that, 'there will be no peace for the wicked' and the word of God must come to pass. There is a man in my country,when he was in power,he looted the country's fund without doing anything. After he left,he was trying to fix things up in the country to stop corruption,but it was all in vain because when he was able to change the system,instead he saw it as a smart idea to loot.

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: Quote from: Raceonsucced on January 29, 2023, 12:10:21 PMCorruption often occurs in government, and hinders the growth of the country. There are many corruptors who are caught and end up in prison, but there are also many who are not caught. In my opinion, corrupt people are always covered in anxiety, for fear of being found out by their superiors. But do you think when someone becomes corrupt, will he be happy or miserable in the future?I also think it's important to evaluate the consequences of corruption. When someone is corrupt, they injure not only themselves, but also others. They take advantage of others who are less powerful, or they divert resources that could have been utilized to aid others. So they are not only destroying their own mental health and inner life, but they are also endangering the lives of others. I believe it is apparent that corruption does not lead to real pleasure, either for the individual or society as a whole. So, even if a corrupt person is able to earn worldly wealth, they would still lack these key values. As a result, their lives would be unsatisfactory and unhappy.
